column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Everyone hates the thieves,\nbut their leader, Goban, is\nreally a great man.
column3: 虽然大家都很厌恶山上的盗贼，不过，\n盗贼的老大古邦是可个了不起的人物。

column2: <!empty>
Once, when I was under\nattack, he came to my aid.\nSaved my life, he did!
column3: 以前我差点被魔物攻击的时候，\n还是古邦出手救了我。

column2: If you ever get the chance,\nyou really should talk to\nhim.
column3: 要是有机会的话，\n可以找他袒诚布公的聊一聊。

column2: <!empty>

Oh, you've met Goban, have
you? I told you he wasn't
your average, run-of-the-mill
thief, didn't I?
column3: 哦，你跟古邦谈过了吗。\n他看起来不像普通的盗贼是吧？

column2: <!empty>

There have been robberies
left and right these days,
but I just don't believe
Goban is to blame.
column3: 虽然最近经常发生窃盗案，\n但我还是相信不是他干的。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

You should keep away from
the shrine on the mountain.
They say it's haunted by
hooded ghouls!
column3: 你千万不可以靠近山上的神殿哦。\n那里会出披着头巾的亡灵。

column2: Those who enter the\nshrine are doomed never\nto return again...
column3: 不瞒你说，去神殿的人，\n到现在都还没有人可以活着回来。

column2: <!empty>
...What's that? You say\nyou defeated the spirits\nin the shrine?
column3: 你说什么...你把山上神殿\n披头巾的亡灵给打倒了？

column2: And here you are, in one\npiece. How stunning!
column3: 那你竟然能平安无事的回来。

column2:
The spirits of the shrine
may have been quieted...
but now, something odd is
happening in the fields.
column3: 神殿的亡灵好像消失了，不过...\n这次换成草原那边发生不思议的事情。

column2:
If you listen, you can hear
a whispering voice carried
on the wind...but I have no
idea where it's coming from!
column3: 有种喃喃细语的声音会随着温暖的风一起飘过来，\n也不知道那声音来自哪里。\n想想还真是可怕唷...

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

If you ask me, it's trouble.
With so many elderly people
here, we're sitting ducks if
ghouls should come knocking...
column3: 我们村子老人居多，\n万一遭到魔物攻击，\n三两下就完蛋了。

column2: <!empty>

Though we haven't been attacked
yet. Not even once! Supposedly
all thanks to the village's
treasure: the Silver Bell.
column3:
不过最不可思议的是，
到现在村子都还没有被攻击过。
大家都说那是村宝『银之铃』的声音
把魔物打退的。

column2:
If that bell's sound keeps
monsters away...well, then
that bell is my new best
friend, for sure!
column3: 如果真是这样，那真是太庆幸了。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

Out of the blue, the Thieves'
Den was established next to Darm
Tower. I hear it was built there
to block up the entrance.
column3:
『达姆之塔』旁边不知道
什么时候冒出了盗贼的碉堡。
好像是故意建在那里，
要塞住塔的入口的样子。

column2:
Not that I mind having thieves
between me and that accursed
tower...but why? Why would they
set up in such a place?!
column3: 那些人为什么要专门挑在\n那么危险的地方建立基地呢？

column2: Monsters, thieves...\nI honestly don't know\nwhich is worse.
column3: 不论是魔物还是盗贼...\n我完全搞不懂他们是怎么想的啦。

column2: Good afternoon, Adol.
column3: 午安，亚特鲁先生。

column2: Thanks to you, I'm once again\nable to play my music for the\ntownsfolk.
column3: 托你的福，\n我又可以让村子的大家\n欣赏我的表演了。

column2: I am forever in your debt.
column3: 真的很感谢你。\n请接受我由衷的致谢。

column2: Now, I must ask that you\nexcuse me. I...hope that\nour paths will cross again.
column3: 那么我告辞了。\n希望...我们的道路能再次交汇。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Out in the western fields,\nthere are two giant trees.
column3: 西边广大的草原上\n有对双生树。

column2: One is toward the south,\nand the other is west of\nthe old mine.
column3: 其中一棵的位置在这里的南边，\n另一棵树在银矿山的西边。

column2:
When I was young, I used to
go out and pick delicious
fruit all the time. Wish
I could do that again...
column3: 我们还小的时候，\n双生树还会长出好吃的果实，不过...\n现在已经几乎都采不到了。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
I wonder when I'll get\nto hear Reah play her\nharmonica again...
column3: 以后不知道还有没有机会\n再听到蕾雅吹奏口琴了...\n

column2:
She likes to travel to all the
towns and villages in Esteria,
to share her beautiful music.
I do worry for her safety, though.
column3: 她好像是独自一个人游走艾斯塔里亚各地\n的城镇村落演奏的样子...\n真担心她会不会被魔物攻击。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>

I saw a very suspicious-looking
man wearing a black cape earlier.
He was in an awful hurry! Ran
right out of town, to the north.
column3:
不久前我看到一个很可疑的家伙。
大热天的披着黑斗篷，
一点都不知道热啊，那个人。
我就看他匆匆忙忙的从村子的北边出口离开。

column2: <!empty>

There's nothing up there
but monsters and thieves.
I wonder if he fell into
either category...
column3: 住在那个方向的，不是魔怪就是盗贼，\n不可能有别的了...\n他到底是什么人呢？

column2: He certainly could've,\nwhat with how overtly\nsneaky he was acting!
column3: 唉，不管哪一边，总之啊，\n那家伙绝不是什么正经的人。

column2:
That girl staying at Jeba's
house has amnesia. Isn't that
awful? Such a lovely girl, and
she doesn't even know who she is!
column3: 听说洁瓦家的女孩\n得了记忆丧失症？\n可怜呀，亏她长得那么可爱。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

Luta's disappeared again...
He can be so thoughtless
sometimes. His lovely wife
is quite worried about him!
column3:
卢达那家伙
又不见人影了吗...
让美丽的太太整天为他操心，
他真是个罪恶深重的男人。

column2:
*sigh* I wish I had a
cute girlfriend who'd
worry about ME if I
suddenly vanished...
column3:
啊...
我也想要一个
当我不在的时候，
会为我担心的女朋友。

column2: Have you heard? There's\nthis really gorgeous girl\nstaying in the village!
column3: 你知道吗？\n现在我们村子\n有个可爱得要命的女孩子哦。

column2: Her name's Feena. Isn't\nthat a pretty name? I\njust HAVE to talk to her...
column3: 她的名字叫『菲娜』。\n瞧，连名字都很可爱吧？\n不知道有没有跟她增进友谊的办法。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>

The mayor is acting quite...
suspect. He keeps wandering
around the village, muttering
something under his breath.
column3: 村长的样子不大对劲。\n每天都像游魂似的\n在村子里面晃来晃去。

column2:
Something about giving the
thieves everything he owns,
and hoping that's enough.
What is THAT all about?!
column3: 还不时自言自语的说\n『我的家当全部拿出来\n能够让那些人满意吗？』这样。

column2: Mayor Robels usually hums\ngaily during his strolls.
column3: 村长现在心情好得不得了，\n在村子里面散步的时候还会哼歌呢。

column2: This time, he looked pale\nand nervous. I wonder what\ncould be upsetting him so...
column3: 不久前\n他的脸色还是惨绿绿的...\n难道是他的烦恼解决了吗？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Reah's harmonica has such\na clear, beautiful sound\nto it...
column3: 蕾雅小姐的口琴\n听起来既干净，又美丽...。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
A strange old woman\nnamed Jeba lives\nin this village.
column3: 我们村子有位神奇的奶奶，\n名字叫『洁瓦』。

column2: <!empty>

When I was young, she told me all
about the history of Esteria. Long
ago, this was a bigger, lovelier
country, ruled by two Goddesses...
column3:
她很了解艾斯塔里亚的历史，
小时候我们经常听她说故事呢。
听说古时候这个地方
曾经有个女神统治的美丽国家...。

column2:
If you're looking to hear more,
you should talk to her. I'm sure
she'll be happy to prattle on
about it to someone new!
column3: 你有什么事想知道的话，\n可以去拜访洁瓦。

column2: <!empty>
Ah, you're Adol, no? Feena\ntold me all about you. She\nsaid you saved her life!
column3: 啊，你就是亚特鲁先生吗？\n我听菲娜说了。\n听说是你救她出来的。

column2: <!empty>
We've become fast friends.\nShe's a truly sweet girl.
column3: 我和她很快就成为朋友了。\n她真的是很温柔、很善良的好女孩...

column2:
You be sure to look after her.
She puts up a brave front, but
the truth is, she's terrified
of the person she might've been.
column3: 你要好好爱惜她哦。\n别看她好像一副不在乎的样子，\n其实失去记忆这件事，令她内心很不安的。

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Minea's in a bad way.\nThe thieves have been on\na rampage there lately.
column3: 米内亚那边也不平静的样子。\n听说那里现在\n盗贼很猖獗。

column2: Guess it's because that's\nwhere all the rich folks\nlive...
column3: 米内亚跟我们村子不同，\n有钱人家比较多，\n当然容易被盗贼盯上了。

column2:
In this village, the only thing
of any real value is the Silver
Bell, and that's safe in Mayor
Robel's house.
column3: 这个村子唯一可能被偷的东西，\n大概也只有罗贝鲁斯村长家\n的『银之铃』而已吧？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
<!empty>
Have you been to the lakeshore?\nIt's soooo pretty! You should go\nsee it for yourself sometime!
column3: 你有去过湖畔看看吗？\n那地方很漂亮，\n值得一看哦。

column2: <!empty>
The pier, especially,\nis the perfect spot for\nbasking in the sun.
column3: 特别是栈桥的上头，\n那是享受日光浴的最佳场所。

column2: <!empty>

But you gotta go
early, or someone
else will beat you
to it!
column3: 不过往往当你去的时候，已经有人先占领了。

column2: Miss Feena is so pretty...\nand she's nice, too!
column3: 菲娜姐姐长得好漂亮哦。\n又温柔，又高雅...

column2:
Yesterday, when we sat
in the sun together on
the pier...would that be
considered...a date?
column3: 昨天我们还一起\n在栈桥晒太阳哦！这样子\n可以算是约会吗？

column2: <!empty>
<!empty>
Zzz...
column3: Zzzz...

column2: <!empty>
